result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Hill II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to costs. Costs paid in full. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-No dangerous weapons. 
-No contact with the Victim or Witness. 
-Domestic Violence counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James P Hill II

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Andy Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 10:13 AM
Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for James P Hill II.
Defendant James P Hill II in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
30-DAYS JAIL
Sentence to run Consecutive to 22CM232 and 22CM1126.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent Contact with the Victim or Witness
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $150.00 to be applied to the costs/surcharges* AND *Cash Bail from 22CM1126 is to be applied to the costs/surcharge*

Case called at 1:41 PM 
Andy Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James P Hill in court with attorney J. Andrew Herbers.
Attorney Herbers requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Apply cash bail previously posted.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:05 AM Defendant James P Hill in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
